hello all: i hv couple of files... named same....say .c
now... i want to rename all these files with .cc
how can i do that with one command?
i hv checked "rename"...but it don`t work
if you want to rename multiple files, have a look at mmv
mmv (multiple move) is probably exactly what you are looking for. it allows you to do things like "some file.txt" -> "some_file.text" or whatever
[nrx] : i used to have a pcmcia gprs card going back 2 years. it worked fine. i just had to set the maximum packet size while configuring the interface.
mmv don`t work for multiple file rename
just type the sign. it's how mmv knows which argument you mean. for example -> mmv "*.*" "#2.#1" would make out of example.txt txt.example
